data.title: Pranjal Chalise Felicitated as Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021
data.snippet:
Mr. Pranjal was selected among the Top Six Finalists of the competition viz Mr. Anurag Chapagain, (18 years, Youtuber, Nawalparasi); Mr. Deepak Sutihar (19 years, Social Entrepreneur, Saptari); Ms. Khusbu Bhandari, (18 years,Wildlife Conservationist, Chitwan); Ms. Neha Gurung, (19 years, Social Activist, Kathmandu); and Ms. Sabhya Rai, (19 years, Education Activist, IIam)

Mr. Pranjal Chalise has aided the Blind Community by inventing Drishti Nepal, which helps the blind community in currency bills recognition and cash transactions. [...] Likewise, He has developed a mobile application that provides agricultural news and information from authentic sources and another app includes-a Women Safety app to ensure the security of women and ensure they are not deprived of opportunities due to their safety reasons.

His other two educational apps have 7500 users. Pranjal has also initiated a non-profit tech venture E-educators Nepal‚Äô, which enhances the quality of online education and makes educational resources more accessible.

Furthermore, He is the member of the board of Initiative in Nepal Foundation, and currently working on a research paper about the Blockchain Technology and Smart Contracts and the ways in which technological advancement can mitigate the costs of elongated transaction processes. [...] # Pranjal Chalise Felicitated as Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021

Nepal News Agency

Shares

Share

Tweet

Share

Kathmandu. Mr. Pranjal Chalise,19 years old Technopreneur from Kathmandu has been awarded the title of ‚ÄúWai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021‚Äù amidst a Virtual Award ceremony organized by Glocal Pvt. Ltd today.

It is the seventh iteration of the Glocal Teen Hero Award, which is the only national platform in Nepal to identify and honor outstanding teenagers whose creativity, commitment, experience, and strong leadership have helped them achieve success in life.

Glocal Teen Hero 2021- Winners NEPAL Pranjal Chalise 19 years old Technopreneur INDIA Radhika Gupta 16 years old Educationist SRI LANKA Sachintha Chamaranga Abeyrathne 18 years old Social Entrepreneur Glocal Annual Report ‚Äì 2021 Glocal International Teen Conference 2021 Glocal International Teen Conference (GITC) is an amazing platform for passionate teenagers from around the globe to share their insights, initiation, and perspectives to bring impact in the society and respectively in the world. The conference aims to address the issues and overcome the barriers by boosting leadership, empowerment, and social impact through a participatory and interactive environment with [...] Glocal Annual Report ‚Äì 2021 Year Name Title Address 2015 Ms. Bipana Sharma Child Right Activist Nawalparasi. Nepal 2016 Mr. Santosh Lamichhane Mechanical Enthusiast Lalitpur, Nepal 2017 Mr. Sachin Dangi Social Worker/ Activist Dang, Nepal 2018 Ms. Prashansha KC Social Activist/ YouTuber Rukum, Nepal 2019 Mr. Samir Phuyal Entrepreneur Morang, Nepal Mr. Monishwaran Maheswaran Innovator Bangalore, India 2020 Ms. Mandira Shrestha Health Activist Ramechhap, Nepal Mr. Vivaan Kabir Youth Activist Mumbai, India Ms. Menuri Sachintha Activist Madapatha, Sri Lanka 2021 Ms. Pranjal Chalise Technopreneur Kathmandu, Nepal Ms. Radhika Gupta Educationist Uttar Pradesh, India Mr. Sachintha Chamaranga Abeyrathne Social Entrepreneur Piliyandala, Srilanka Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021 Wai Wai Glocal [...] Srilanka Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021 Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021 was held virtually on September 1, 2021. Everything was conducted online, from the start of the application until the recognition of teens. In the first round, a virtual press conference and a call for applications were held. Following that, virtual activation was held in over 200 schools in order to reach out to teenagers and provide information about Glocal Teen Hero. Glocal's 20under20 were chosen and the top six finalists were announced. Those finalists were nurtured and trained in virtual Self Competency Development session. On the last day of the event, one fantastic teen was awarded as Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal at Virtual Award Gala. Mr. Pranjal Chalise, 19 years old technopreneur won the title of

data.title: [PDF] Kahani: Culturally-Nuanced Visual Storytelling Tool for Non-Western ...
data.snippet: 9 ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS We are grateful to Monojit Choudhury for his insights on CSIs and Mohit Jain for his valuable feedback on the paper. We also extend our gratitude to Varun Gumma and Pranjal Chitale for their discussions on the evaluation metric and Sanoop Menon for his support during the data analysis process. Special thanks to all the reviewers and participants who contributed their time and insights to this study. We also thank Global Cornell for partly supporting this work. Lastly, we are thankful to the Compliance Team at Microsoft for their swift and timely support, without which this study and paper would not have been possible. [...] Marcelo Viridiano, Marcos Estecha-Garitagoitia, Maria Camila Buitrago Cabrera, Mario Rodr√≠guez-Cantelar, M√©lanie Jouitteau, Mihail Mihaylov, Mohamed Fazli Mohamed Imam, Muhammad Farid Adilazuarda, Munkhjargal Gochoo, Munkh-Erdene Otgonbold, Naome Etori, Olivier Niyomugisha, Paula M√≥nica Silva, Pranjal Chitale, Raj Dabre, Rendi Chevi, Ruochen Zhang, Ryandito Diandaru, Samuel Cahyawijaya, Santiago G√≥ngora, Soyeong Jeong, Sukannya Purkayastha, Tatsuki Kuribayashi, Teresa Clifford, Thanmay Jayakumar, Tiago Timponi Torrent, Toqeer Ehsan, Vladimir Araujo, Yova Kementchedjhieva, Zara Burzo, Zheng Wei Lim, Zheng Xin Yong, Oana Ignat, Joan Nwatu, Rada Mihalcea, Thamar Solorio, and Alham Fikri Aji. 2024. [...] The relatability of the characters‚Äô actions and experiences was another aspect participants valued. For example, P4 noted how the mention of bedtime storytelling felt familiar, stating, ‚Äú..commonly seen in India where grandmothers tell bedtime stories‚Äù. Similarly P1 commented on a relatable scene,‚Äú...she giggled as she watched the monkey from her window...‚Äù. This highlights how the partici-pants connected with these everyday interactions. The relevance of character names was also appreciated, which created a sense of belonging and fostered a strong connection between the char-acters and the participants, as P2 noted ‚Äú.. The names that were used Gopal, Mina, and Arun seemed very relevant, similar to common South Indian names used in Kerala...‚Äù.

data.title: Sah felicitated as Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2022
data.snippet:
+ Top six finalists of Wai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2022 announced
    + Glocal‚Äôs 20 under 20 names announced for 8th edition
    + Activation programme to inform about Glocal Teen Hero Nepal concluded
    + Application open for 8th edition of ‚ÄòWai Wai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal‚Äô
    + Glocal organises third edition of Skill Week
    + Pranjal Chalise felicitated as WaiWai Glocal Teen Hero Nepal 2021
    + Glocal Teen Hero opens application for its 7th edition [...] soul to diversifying astronomy for all.  In order to access the availability for all, he carried such fragile instruments to the nook and corner of Nepal making the space dream a reality and reaching more than 7,000 students as of now. Similarly, he worked to eradicate the issue of language hindering in astronomy. His team has committed to translations working on 'Handbook on Astronomical Instrument', a free-readiness. His initiation exists in taking Nepali Astronomy internationally, where he has been aiding and empowering to take Nepali students to compete in international astronomy. He has also contributed to unprivileged and poor government school students to dream big without any issues. The impact has been acting as a bridge for unprivileged students of rural Nepal, India, and the [...] He has also dedicated himself completely developing resources for students all over Nepal. He is working to change the perception involving, initiating, and sustaining multiple fronts of astronomy from outreach to translations to research with NASA and representing Nepal.  He founded the 1st internationally affiliated high school club of Nepal, and the 1st Aviation and Aerospace based organisation venture within SEDS-Nepal and SEDS-US. In addition, Sah represented Nepal among more than 20 countries and showcased Nepali governmental institutions, and excelled in the venture of Space travel where the team worked out the best and cheapest costing around Rs 30,000 compared to Rs 100,000 to launch Sano Satellites. He has devoted his soul to diversifying astronomy for all.  In order to access
